sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Military Compensation Records Act.

sections.heading: The Adjutant General and the Service Recognition Board,
sections.text:
respectively, are authorized to destroy any records in their custody
relating to the payment of compensation to veterans of World War I and to
persons who served in the armed forces between September 16, 1940 and
September 3, 1945, if such records have first been microphotographed,
photographed, microfilmed or otherwise reproduced on film and provision has
been made for the filing and preservation of the reproductions.
